what: squidSim: a flexible simulation tool for linear mixed models.
title: Statistical Quantification of Individual Differences
text: squidSim package simulation tool can used research educational purposes. main aim aid empiricists understanding linear mixed effects model hierarchical data. package allows hierarchical data structure created imported, used basis simulations. also provides tools sampling data multiple ways. package designed flexibility mind can simulate huge variety different models, including simulation genetic phylogenetic effects. framework suitable performing simulation studies, determining optimal sampling designs user-specific biological problems, making simulation based inferences aid interpretation empirical studies. squidSim also teaching tool biologists interested learning, teaching others, implement interpret mixed-effects models.

text: extensive vignette, strongly recommend reading using package (link). Briefly, load squidSim package R: squidSim two main functions: make_structure(): simulate_population():

title: Statistical Quantification of Individual Differences
text: SQuID stands Statistical Quantification Individual Differences refers working group behavioural evolutionary ecologists (link main group page). Understanding sources phenotypic variance core component huge amount research ecology evolutionary biology. Phenotypic variation typically structured hierarchical way hierarchical modelling mixed effect models provides great tool analyze decompose variation. Mixed models flexible statistical tools provide way estimate variation different levels, represent general statistical framework ecology evolutionary biology. progress computational capacities mixed models become increasingly popular among ecologists evolutionary biologists last decade. However, fitting mixed model straightforward exercise, way data sampled among within groups can strong implications outcome model. Mixed models therefore present highly flexible yet challenging tool. major aim SQuID working group provide educational resources help empiricists learn properties, potentials interpretational challenges mixed effects models. group formed workshop 2013, first squid R package made (link), aim helping empiricists interested decomposing phenotypic variance get familiar concept hierarchical organization traits, mixed models avoid pitfalls caused inappropriate sampling. first squid R package fairly limited range models can used simulate data. aim current package overcome limitations provide coherent reproducible framework simulations, research education.

title: Make nested and crossed balanced hierarchical structures — make_structure
Make nested and crossed balanced hierarchical structures — make_structure
text: structure formula specifying structure sample sizes level. See details. repeat_obs Number repeated observations lowest level ... arguments passed methods.

title: Make nested and crossed balanced hierarchical structures — make_structure
text: data.frame data structure

title: Make nested and crossed balanced hierarchical structures — make_structure
text: Factors input text string. name factor followed number levels factor brackets e.g. "individual(100)". Nested factors can specified using "/", e.g. "population(2)/individual(2)", lower levels specified higher levels, sample sizes lower levels

title: Make nested and crossed balanced hierarchical structures — make_structure
text: Joel Pick - joel.l.pick@gmail.com

title: Make nested and crossed balanced hierarchical structures — make_structure
code: # simple data structure with 5 'individuals' and 2 observations per individual make_structure(structure="individual(5)", repeat_obs=2) #>    individual #> 1           1 #> 2           1 #> 3           2 #> 4           2 #> 5           3 #> 6           3 #> 7           4 #> 8           4 #> 9           5 #> 10          5  # nested data structure with 2 sexes, 5 individuals per sex # and 2 observations per individual make_structure(structure="sex(2)/individual(5)", repeat_obs=2) #>    sex individual #> 1    1          1 #> 2    1          1 #> 3    1          2 #> 4    1          2 #> 5    1          3 #> 6    1          3 #> 7    1          4 #> 8    1          4 #> 9    1          5 #> 10   1          5 #> 11   2          6 #> 12   2          6 #> 13   2          7 #> 14   2          7 #> 15   2          8 #> 16   2          8 #> 17   2          9 #> 18   2          9 #> 19   2         10 #> 20   2         10  # crossed data structure with 5 individuals in 2 treatments  # and 2 observations per individual and treatment combination make_structure(structure="treatment(2) + individual(5)", repeat_obs=1) #>    treatment individual #> 1          1          1 #> 2          1          2 #> 3          1          3 #> 4          1          4 #> 5          1          5 #> 6          2          1 #> 7          2          2 #> 8          2          3 #> 9          2          4 #> 10         2          5

title: simulate_population — simulate_population
text: Simulate population level data

title: simulate_population — simulate_population
code: simulate_population(   data_structure,   N,   parameters,   N_response = 1,   known_predictors,   model,   family = "gaussian",   link = "identity",   pedigree,   pedigree_type,   phylogeny,   phylogeny_type,   cov_str,   sample_type,   sample_param,   sample_plot = FALSE,   N_pop = 1 )

title: simulate_population — simulate_population
text: data_structure matrix dataframe named column grouping factor, including levels N Sample size data_structure specified parameters list parameters hierarchical level. See details. N_response number response variables, defaults 1. known_predictors option provides way inputting existing predictor variables, without simulating predictors. argument takes list, item 'predictors' 'betas', 'predictors' matrix dataframe model Optional. family description error distribution. Default "gaussian". link description link function distribution. Default "identity". pedigree list pedigrees hierarchical level. pedigree must matrix data.frame, least 3 columns, correspond ID, dam sire. pedigree_type list describing kind genetic variance simulated pedigree. Default 'additive', options 'dominance' 'epistatic'. Makes use relationship matrices created nadiv package. phylogeny list phylogenies hierarchical level. pedigree phylo class. phylogeny_type list describing mode evolution simulated phylogeny. Options 'brownian'(default) 'OU'. cov_str list covariance structures hierarchical level. sample_type Type sampling, needs one 'nested', 'missing' temporal. See details sample_param set parameters, specific sampling type. See details. sample_plot Logical. illustrative plots made - defaults FALSE. N_pop Number populations. Default = 1

title: simulate_population — simulate_population
text: squid object, list including inputs simulated data.

title: simulate_population — simulate_population
text: Parameter list ...

title: simulate_population — simulate_population
text: Joel Pick - joel.l.pick@gmail.com

title: simulate_population — simulate_population
code: # simple linear model with three predictors variables squid_data <- simulate_population(   parameters = list(     observation = list(       names = c("temperature","rainfall", "wind"),       beta = c(0.5,-0.3, 0.4)       ),     residual = list(       vcov = 1     )   ),   N=2000 )
